Projects

As a Full Stack Engineer I believe that it is vital for me to keep a varied project load at all times. Without the ability to switch between different types of web stacks, I would not be a true Full Stack Engineer. Below is a link to my projects display page where you can see just how varied (and long) my list of projects is!

My projects Display Page
Growbotix
Personal
Growbotix is built on a community of Farmers. We have built a digital interface to monitor the physical world that our users have invest in so heavily.
An IoT based company that leverages open source hardware and microservices to interface with the real world. Through the digitization of the food growing process we can not only monitor and document it, but we can improve and theorize on it.
Ziptopia
Interview Related
I am currently data mining an autonomous car simulation for my "12 week challenge" and I need your help!!!!
more info
Click or scroll down.
Taking a coding challenge a little too far in the interest of collecting too much data. As this is for a personal challenge I felt it neccessary to entertain one of my flaws: Getting in too deep. Come jump in the deep end with me and find out more by clicking above!!!!

Resume

My Online resume shows how many programming languages I know, and where my prefence for each of them lies. Like my list of projects my resume covers a large list of different types of expereience. Much like my varied projects list keeps my skills up to date, my varied resume ensures that my foundation has me extremely prepared.

The list of my frameworks is...

  • AngularJS
  • Tornado
  • Django
  • Laravel
  • Semantic UI
  • Arduino
  • Raspbery PI GPIO
  • Gulp
  • Browser Sync
  • Panini
  • JQuery
  • Need to see the list again?

Battleship
Interview Related
Creating battleship, as a web app using Angular as the front end, and Tornado on the back end. This is currently being done as one part of a "12 Week Challenge" which I am a third of the way into.
While searching for a new job I was given the challenge to program battleship as a web app. The challenge itself asked a lot less of me than what I am doing, but I saw this as a good chance to get deeper into web sockets. This idea also fueled a challenge with myself to see if I could gain as many new skills in three months of hard work, as I could in a year of contract work at Autodesk.
Internal Team Website
Autodesk Related
After getting changed over to the cloud security team I built out a website that would help clear up confusion on cloud related issues within the companies employee base. This site also allowed for our team to reach back out to our users through blogs, news updates, and git repos.
This website acts as a base point for the cloud security team of Autodesk to get information about themselves out to fellow employees. This allows us to ensure that any team running within our cloud is using the proper amazon AMIs for our tools to scan for security reports.
